data.text: @covid19nz What if a household +ve becomes -ve on its D3 and another housemate becomes positive and symptomatic on the D3 then at their D 10 another member tested positive regardless whether they have symptoms or they ha e not. Does last member  will be the only one to continue to isolate?

@acruz43026789 Kia ora, no. Household Contacts are allowed to leave isolation at the same time as the original positive case provided they test negative on Day 3 and Day 10. 
More information here: https://t.co/L47MFQFUar

@covid19nz When a member of the family becomes symptomatic and tested positive, the whole household will isolate as well, right? On their 7th day, another member becomes symptomatic and tested positive, do all of them isolate for another 10 days?

@minhealthnz It's the process that is the problem. People should not be asked to go out if they have symptoms. Also, do you know that my GP office doesn't answer the phone? They are so overwhelmed they just don't answer. If you look into this, my provider probably isn't the only one.

@rialittle Kia ora, yes they can. They should monitor closely for symptoms and get tested again if they feel unwell. Positive cases should try to isolate away from other household members as much as possible, including sleeping in a different bed if you have one.

@ZewuJunKnows Kia ora we are sorry to hear this and understand your frustration. Please be patient and kind to the staff. There is huge demand and they are doing their best, if your symptoms get worse please see your medical provider.
@covid19nz @minhealthnz This is not good. Can't isolate while in a queue with my kids!! WTFFF

@covid19nz We need a better way to get the tests into peoples homes or they will not be used. How can household contacts test as directed above if getting tests is such a huge effort. Many people won’t do it I’m afraid.

@covid19nz Can you feedback that the distribution system for RAT tests is still really difficult and not accessible? I ordered on the new website but it still requires queuing in an enormous line of cars to collect. This is not practical when you have children, sick people and work.
